page.title: 02FARMING AND INDUSTRY
page.content: A small stream , which joins the River Avon , follows the Salisbury _ Portsmoth railway line which runs though the area from West to East.The railway line also follows the disused foundations of the Salisbury Canal which was begun in 1795 and abandoned in 1808. The pastureland is used for grazing horses,sheep and cattle.The major crops are types of grain.There is a pig farm and a battery hen farm.The woodland is owned now mostly by the farmers or the Economic Forestry Group.A small area of woodland near West Grimstead is used by local charcoal burners.There is a large chalk quarry owned by E.C.C.Quarries, Ltd. The area includes part of Clarendon Park Estate.
